3. Congestive heart failure .
4. Hypertension .
5. Gout .
PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE :
Laparoscopic right hemicolectomy .
SECONDARY PROCEDURE :
Laparoscopic cholecystectomy .
History and physical as per copy on the chart .
HISTORY :
Briefly , this is an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old female with a prior history of a GI bleed in **DATE[Nov 2007] .
She was found to have an ileocecal mass and a colon polyp .
She was admitted into **INSTITUTION on **DATE[Dec 10 2007] , and on the same day taken to the OR where under general anesthesia , laparoscopic right colectomy and cholecystectomy were performed .
The patient tolerated the procedure well and was taken to the recovery room in stable condition and was transferred to the floor .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient recovered without any complications .
Diet was increased as tolerated .
The patient was discharged home in stable condition on **DATE[Dec 16 2007] .
Instructions to the patient :
Activity as tolerated .
Diet as tolerated .
MEDICATIONS :
1. Aspirin 81 mg daily .
2. Lasix 20 mg daily .
3. Indocin SR 75 mg daily .
4. Lisinopril 10 mg daily .
5. Lopressor 50 mg b.i.d.
6. Nitroglycerin patch 0.2 mg transdermal once a day .
FOLLOWUP :
The patient was to follow up with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] in 2 weeks and Dr. **NAME[UUU] in 1 month .
